title: If the universe is a simulation, why would it make everything move away? - Quora

response.answer_text: To answer that you’d have to know the motivation and intent and model the simulators was using. Perhaps they are testing out various cosmological models and this one we are in is just one with an omega value that produces expansion. Maybe they are modelling a universe like theirs. Maybe they’ve got a bad programmer and a parameter was entered incorrectly. Answer to: If the universe is a simulation, why would it make everything move away?

simple, the simulation is constantly downloading new mods like pollution, futuristic technology’s, suicidal millennials ext.… and that is just for the game earth, since more space is required the simulators are adding space by upgrading storage, a phenomena we perceive as “expansion” it’s a 3d thing which is why we see the red and blue shifts respectively

I’d tend to suspect that such observations have an element of miscalculation or illusion, because if “everything” is moving away from Earth in every direction, then the often mocked, much derided Geocentrists are correct.

It is not a simulation but waves. It everything is made by waves, we should think that it will lose energy just because there is expansion. At long term, there is no force available to hold the expansion except if there is a huge amount of energy coming into our direction outside the universe.

Why not? If such technological progress has reached the point where a simulation like ours is possible, then there could have already been billions and billions of iterations of this same kind of simulation with slightly different variables. That’s just one manipulable condition variable that doesn’t need any particular reason to exist or not to exist the way it does.
So you will never be able to see the edges of the simulation and start to figure things out.
and move not away at once; whether the universe is a simulation, that’s a big IF son;
